channel.title: [Resolved-ish] Feel free to remove
channel.description:
I'll start off by saying this was and has been working since I started using my client, but today has stopped working. I've sat here on google for an hour, and I'm resorting to begging.
My OS is Win7
I did use a Win7 converter to make the run.bat a .exe, which also did not change anything.
Client is Blurr if it's important. The run.bat doesn't even load the client at all, it opens the first cmd screen that closes instantly... and then nothing.
Keep in mind it was working fine up until today. Is there any way I can fix this without resorting to changing my run.bat?
Current run.bat: [code]@echo off cd Client Files start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui close [/code]

item.title: [Resolved-ish] Feel free to remove
item.dc:creator: @V_1_N_C_H V 1 N C H
item.description:
@V_1_N_C_H wrote:

It should still open the client, Then fail.

Also…Try renaming some stuff…you have Inception of copies.

Read full topic

item.title: [Resolved-ish] Feel free to remove
item.dc:creator: @darthbonsly darthbonsly
item.description:
@darthbonsly wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:14, topic:457209”]That means it’s not loading the client, or something is causing it to crash.
Post the whole CMD log of the Client on startup.[/quote]

I downloaded two previous release versions of my client and neither of them will open either… I downloaded the original client I edited and it opened fine, so I poured the contents of my current client files into it and then it failed to launch… If my client files are corrupt, why would they stop working now?

[Update]
Apparently my ISP was suspecting me of phishing because my neighbor who was trying to leech my net got pissed and reported me. Pretty sure he’s getting fined…
The result was is that from what I understand, they were blocking anything that I was porting, which included my server, which if wasn’t ported, my run.bat wouldn’t launch the client.
This has been interesting…

Read full topic

item.title: [Resolved-ish] Feel free to remove
item.dc:creator: @darthbonsly darthbonsly
item.description:
@darthbonsly wrote:

WikiPedia:
" In DOS, OS/2, and also Microsoft Windows, batch file is the name given to a type of script file, a text file containing a series of commands to be executed by the command interpreter."

An obscure site:
“Batch files or scripts are small easy-to-write text files that carry out a series of commands. They can be simple enough that even the average home computer user can take advantage of them.”

I looked this up a month ago when I decided to customize my first client for the record.

Within the last two hours of super fun time I:
Changed the close to pause to check errors
Changed the Java location multiple times
???
Confused myself

I do understand and appreciate the way spoon-feeding is avoided/discouraged, and I wasn’t feeling great starting this thread. Sorry for being redundant.

Read full topic

item.title: [Resolved-ish] Feel free to remove
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“darthbonsly, post:9, topic:457209”]Is there some other forum section that can help me with perhaps my computer being at fault… I said I didn’t know where else to go.
I’m not feeling the beauty of the community, I wanted to get into pservers for fun, tbh it’s hell… Been running a server for awhile and every bit of rsps community is shit.[/quote]
+1 for taking my shit.
-1 for not trying to solve things on you’re own. I suggest you learn what a batch script is. Then learn Java.
If you present the definition at the link I gave you, I’ll be satisfied.

Read full topic

item.title: [Resolved-ish] Feel free to remove
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Like seriously. Google what a batch script is.

Then, next time you wonder why its just closing, pull your head out of your ass and look closer.

@echo off
cd Client Files
start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
close
